newsitem.title: CANADA: Saskatchewan seeds 92 percent of crop by Sunday.
newsitem.headline: Saskatchewan seeds 92 percent of crop by Sunday.

text.p: Saskatchewan farmers seeded 92 percent of 1997 crops as of Sunday compared to 75 percent at the same time last year and ahead of the five-year average of 85 percent, Saskatchewan Agriculture said in its weekly crop report.
"With the exception of some eastern and northern areas, all areas of the province report over 90 percent of seeding completed," it said.

Topsoil moisture deteriorated due to wind and warm temperatures. Moisture was rated good on 58 percent of crop land, down from 78 percent last week. Some southeastern, south-central and central regions reported poor moisture conditions.
An average 2 mm (0.08 inch) of rain fell on the southern grainbelt although Maple Creek, in the durum-dominated and arid Palliser Triangle region, saw 20 mm (0.8 inch).
Central Saskatchewan reported an average of 1 mm (0.04 inch) of rain. Northern districts saw an average 3 mm (0.12 inch) of rain.
Seeding was completed in the southwest district while plantings were the furthest behind at 80 percent done in the east central district centred around Melville, Sask.
